 ,(https://interfaithrise.org)
About Career Pathways Ι 732-357-0590 Ι info@interfaithrise.org,
info@interfaithrise.org ,(mailto:info@interfaithrise.org)
Career Pathways (CP) serves I-RISE clients by helping them to find and enroll in training programs to boost their work and other skills and increase their marketability and, after program completion, to place them in upgraded jobs. CP offers 2 tracks, Career Advancement and Employment Training Program.,
Our Career Advancement track assists clients, who are already working, to enroll in training programs leading to in-demand, industry-recognized certification or licensure and, upon completion, to help them land upgraded jobs.  ,
The Employment Training Program is a 3-month part-time program offering clients work experience, English language learning, job-readiness training, and job placement. This program serves clients who have little or no work experience or English or some other temporary impediment to participating in the US workforce. ,
Eligibility:  You MUST be an established I-RISE client before you may be referred to Career Pathways.  Please call 732-357-0590 or email info@interfaithrise.org  ,
info@interfaithrise.org ,(mailto:info@interfaithrise.org)
Note:  Not all I-RISE clients qualify for Career Pathways.,
,
Below are resources available in central and southern New Jersey for education or training leading to industry-recognized certificates. Programs may be in-person, virtual, or hybrid.  Examples of programs that may be available with I-RISE funding or, for qualifying individuals, with external funding include:,
,
Commercial Drivers License,
Home Health Aide, Medical Assistant, Patient Care Technician,
Certified Nursing Assistant, Licensed Practical Nurse,
Medical Administrative Assistant, Medical Coding and Billing,
Certified Electronic Health Records Specialist,
Microsoft with Medical Coding, Microsoft with Accounting ,
Comp TIA, Cyber Security, Coding, IT Support Specialist,
Program Management,
Electrician, Plumber,
Nail Technology (manicures and pedicures),
General Resources,
NJ Training Explorer–Search by job, training program and more to find a training that works for you. ,
NJ Training Explorer ,(https://mycareer.nj.gov/training/search?)
CareerOneStop (in English and Spanish),
CareerOneStop ,(https://www.careeronestop.org/)
Sponsored by the U.S. Department of Labor, CareerOneStop is a source for free career exploration tools. CareerOneStop houses over 800 captioned videos (English only) for career exploration: www.careerinfonet.org/videos. To find training programs it can offer and pay for, to qualifying individuals, use its Career One Stop Certification Finder.,
www.careerinfonet.org/videos ,(http://www.careerinfonet.org/videos)
Career One Stop Certification Finder ,(https://www.careeronestop.org/BusinessCenter/Toolkit/find-certifications.aspx?lang=en&frd=true)
Local offices of CareerOneStop, where you can get in-person service, including enrollment in certification training programs, are listed under each county below.,
New Jersey Department of Labor Career Services,
New Jersey Department of Labor Career Services ,(https://nj.gov/labor/career-services/)
SkillUp New Jersey ,
SkillUp New Jersey ,(https://nj.metrixlearning.com/)
Enhance your skills and earn industry-recognized credentials through this free, online learning platform of over 5,000 courses. Register using the link above or your county’s SkillUp link below.  ,
My Next Move ,
My Next Move ,(https://www.mynextmove.org/)
My Next Move is an interactive site that helps job seekers explore their career options. It provides information on job tasks, skills, credentials, and salary range for over 900 careers.,
Employers,
Employer educational benefits offer one of the easiest and least expensive ways to access training leading to certificates. Employers may offer, to qualifying employees, support to pursue education or training leading to certification: in-house certification training programs, access to external certification training programs, new-hire signing bonuses, or tuition reimbursement for certification programs. Some of the many large employers offering these types of support include: Amazon, Bank of America, FedEx, Google, Home Depot, Lowe’s, Starbucks, Target, UPS, Walmart, and Wells Fargo. Ask the Employment team to help you get your first job with an employer that offers educational benefits you might use in the future.,
Massive Open Online Courses (MOOCs), Beginners Guide to Massive Open Online Courses (MOOCs) | Class Central Help Center ,
Beginners Guide to Massive Open Online Courses (MOOCs) | Class Central Help Center ,(https://www.classcentral.com/help/moocs)
MOOCs are courses delivered online and accessible to all. Most, but not all, are free. Paying a small fee allows one to earn a certification upon completion of a course.,

 ,
Interfaith-RISE is a program of the Reformed Church of Highland Park Affordable Housing corporation, a non-profit, 501(c)3 organization that provides affordable housing, supportive services, and connection to meaningful community to low-income individuals and families in central New Jersey. All RCHP-AHC projects are non-discriminatory and are open to the public. Learn more at rchp-ahc.org,
 rchp-ahc.org ,(http://rchp-ahc.org/)
